quickStart.title: Quick Start
content: In the 'Default Settings' tab, set your 'Base Project Folder' where your writing is stored.
Select a project folder from the left panel in the plugin view.
Create scenes (markdown notes) in your folder, then change their status or edit metadata in the right panel.
When you're done writing, press the 'Compile Project' button to merge everything into one file.

content.def: This is the main workspace for the plugin. This folder and its subfolders will be displayed in the 'Folder Tree' on the left.

A special note that holds information (like an outline or synopsis) about its parent folder. You can set its filename pattern (e.g., `{{folder_name}}.md`) in 'Add-on Settings'. This note is excluded from compilation.
This feature gathers all scenes with the 'Completion Status' you've set in 'Compilation Settings' and combines them in order into a single markdown file.
You can easily change the compilation order by dragging and dropping items in the scene list using the handle icon. This order is saved per folder.
Click on any metadata field or tagline area to edit its content directly within the view, without needing to open the note itself.

This plugin's 'Folder Representative Note' feature can work seamlessly with other folder note plugins (e.g., a-folder-note). For best compatibility, set the 'Folder Representative Note Filename' in 'Add-on Settings' to `{{folder_name}}.md`. This allows you to manage the note's content in this plugin while maintaining features from other folder note plugins.
